intro: Tetracera assa, commonly known as the African snowberry, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a fleshy, berry-like structure that contains several seeds. The botanical features of Tetracera assa make it an interesting subject for study in botany and ecology.
